page.title: 16Grafham Water Nature Reserve
page.content: {The Nature Reserve} on the Western boundary of Grafham Water has been established to provide a sanctuary for wild life and covers some 370 acres. It is open to the public at any time, but the hide, from which the water fowl can be observed, is only open on Sundays when a member of the Bedfordshire and Huntingdonshire Naturalists' Trust, who supervise the reserve, is present to give advice and help. {Footpaths}follow the perimeter of the reserve and provide a rewarding insight into the wildlife of the area. In the{hedgerows}small birds and animals abound.Wild roses and brambles have been introduced to provide berries for winter feeding as do hawthorn and sloe bushes.
